paragraphs.content: Psalm 78
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 78

paragraphs.content: Maschil of Asaph.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Maschil of Asaph.

paragraphs.content: Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

paragraphs.content: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:

paragraphs.content: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

paragraphs.content: We will not hide them from their children, shewing to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.
paragraphs.contentHtml: We will not hide them from their children, shewing to the generation to come the praises of the Lord, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.

paragraphs.content: For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:

paragraphs.content: That the generation to come might know them, even the children which should be born; who should arise and declare them to their children:
paragraphs.contentHtml: That the generation to come might know them, even the children which should be born; who should arise and declare them to their children:

paragraphs.content: That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:
paragraphs.contentHtml: That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:

paragraphs.content: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not steadfast with God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not steadfast with God.

paragraphs.content: The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.

paragraphs.content: They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;
paragraphs.contentHtml: They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;

paragraphs.content: And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.

paragraphs.content: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.

paragraphs.content: He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as an heap.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as an heap.

paragraphs.content: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.

paragraphs.content: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.

paragraphs.content: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.

paragraphs.content: And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.

paragraphs.content: And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their lust.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their lust.

paragraphs.content: Yea, they spake against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, they spake against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?

paragraphs.content: Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?

paragraphs.content: Therefore the LORD heard this, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore the Lord heard this, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;

paragraphs.content: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:

paragraphs.content: Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,

paragraphs.content: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.

paragraphs.content: Man did eat angels’ food: he sent them meat to the full.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Man did eat angels’ food: he sent them meat to the full.

paragraphs.content: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.

paragraphs.content: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:
paragraphs.contentHtml: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:

paragraphs.content: And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.

paragraphs.content: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;
paragraphs.contentHtml: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;

paragraphs.content: They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat was yet in their mouths,
paragraphs.contentHtml: They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat was yet in their mouths,

paragraphs.content: The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.

paragraphs.content: For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.

paragraphs.content: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.

paragraphs.content: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and inquired early after God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and inquired early after God.

paragraphs.content: And they remembered that God was their rock, and the high God their redeemer.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they remembered that God was their rock, and the high God their redeemer.

paragraphs.content: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.

paragraphs.content: For their heart was not right with him, neither were they steadfast in his covenant.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For their heart was not right with him, neither were they steadfast in his covenant.

paragraphs.content: But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not: yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not: yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.

paragraphs.content: For he remembered that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he remembered that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.

paragraphs.content: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!
paragraphs.contentHtml: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!

paragraphs.content: Yea, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.

paragraphs.content: They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.

paragraphs.content: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan:
paragraphs.contentHtml: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan:

paragraphs.content: And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.

paragraphs.content: He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.

paragraphs.content: He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their labour unto the locust.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their labour unto the locust.

paragraphs.content: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees with frost.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees with frost.

paragraphs.content: He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.

paragraphs.content: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels among them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels among them.

paragraphs.content: He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;
paragraphs.contentHtml: He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;

paragraphs.content: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt; the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt; the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:

paragraphs.content: But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

paragraphs.content: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

paragraphs.content: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.

paragraphs.content: He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

paragraphs.content: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:

paragraphs.content: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.

paragraphs.content: For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.

paragraphs.content: When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:
paragraphs.contentHtml: When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:

paragraphs.content: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;
paragraphs.contentHtml: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;

paragraphs.content: And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy’s hand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy’s hand.

paragraphs.content: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.

paragraphs.content: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.

paragraphs.content: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.

paragraphs.content: Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.

paragraphs.content: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a perpetual reproach.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a perpetual reproach.

paragraphs.content: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:

paragraphs.content: But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.

paragraphs.content: And he built his sanctuary like high palaces, like the earth which he hath established for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he built his sanctuary like high palaces, like the earth which he hath established for ever.

paragraphs.content: He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:
paragraphs.contentHtml: He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:

paragraphs.content: From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

paragraphs.content: So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.
